bug.author: asdfang
bug.summary: Issues setting up tasks.json â€“ AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'items'
bug.description:
Describe the bug AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'items' when I try to run with my own tasks.json. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
I installed version 0.5.1 with pip yesterday, and used the default initialization label-studio start my_labeling_project --init My tasks.json, inspired by text_pairwise/tasks.json and audio_classification/tasks.json:
<denchmark-code>[ { "data": { "url-a": "https://go.heartex.net/static/samples/game.wav", "url-b": "https://go.heartex.net/static/samples/game.wav" } } ] </denchmark-code>
My config.xml:
<denchmark-code><View> <Pairwise name="pairwise" leftClass="audio-a" rightClass="audio-b" toName="choice-a,choice-b"></Pairwise> <Header value="Choice A"></Header> <Audio name="choice-a" value="$url-a"></Audio> <Header value="Choice B"></Header> <Audio name="choice-b" value="$url-b"></Audio>
<Choices name="selection" toName="choice-a,choice-b" choice="single-radio"> <Choice alias="a" value="A"></Choice> <Choice alias="b" value="B"></Choice> </Choices> </View> </denchmark-code>
Ran with: label-studio start ./my_labeling_project. Got this error:
<denchmark-code>[2020-04-08 14:32:01,802] [werkzeug] [INFO] * Running on http://0.0.0.0:8200/ (Press CTRL+C to quit) [2020-04-08 14:32:01,854] [label_studio.server] [ERROR] Exception on /welcome [GET] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2446, in wsgi_app response = self.full_dispatch_request() File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1951, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.handle_user_exception(e) File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1820, in handle_user_exception reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb) File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/_compat.py", line 39, in reraise raise value File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1949, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.dispatch_request() File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1935, in dispatch_request return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args) File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/label_studio/server.py", line 151, in welcome_page project = project_get_or_create() File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/label_studio/server.py", line 82, in project_get_or_create 'multi_session': False File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/label_studio/project.py", line 611, in get_or_create project = cls.get(project_name, args, context) File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/label_studio/project.py", line 594, in get project = cls._load_from_dir(project_dir, project_name, args, context) File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/label_studio/project.py", line 582, in _load_from_dir return cls(config, project_name, context) File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/label_studio/project.py", line 44, in __init__ self.load_tasks() File "/Users/asdfang/.conda/envs/bm-eval-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/label_studio/project.py", line 64, in load_tasks for task_id, task in tasks.items(): AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'items' </denchmark-code>
Expected behavior I expected to go to http://localhost:8200/ and see two audio files, two radio buttons, and some headers and values. Screenshots If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Environment (please complete the following information):
macOS 10.14.6 Chrome label-studio 0.5.1
I have hundreds of pairs of audio to compare so I'm also looking to work towards a <denchmark-link:https://labelstud.io/guide/tasks.html#Directory-with-JSON-files>directory with JSON files</denchmark-link> for my tasks. It is my understanding that I can edit myself without needing to import through the web interface, but I am confused on what the expected format is as the above doesn't work. Thanks!

comments.comment: Hi, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/asdfang>@asdfang</denchmark-link> ! Instead of modifying tasks.json inside project directory, you have to provide your tasks.json as input file. Please check documentation about importing files <denchmark-link:https://labelstud.io/guide/tasks.html#Import-formats>https://labelstud.io/guide/tasks.html#Import-formats</denchmark-link>
